title: Conde de Siruela 2012 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Unusual but not unpleasant aromas of cinnamon and coffee cake lead to a saturated palate with rugged tannins. Flavors of fig paste, chocolate and baking spices confirm the wine's ripeness, while blackened flavors and rock-hard tannins drive the finish.

title: 1+1=3 NV Cygnus Brut Made With Organic Grapes Sparkling (Cava)
description: Apple and mild citrus aromas are touched up by vanilla but also green notes of lettuce leaf. A citric, acid-driven palate delivers flavors of briny orange and grapefruit, while this wine feels healthy on a long finish.
designation: Cygnus Brut Made With Organic Grapes

title: 12 Linajes 2015 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Brambly berry aromas are woody and a bit fiery. This roble feels sinewy, with structure and intensity. Black-fruit flavors are toasty but not charred or burnt. The finish is full and dark but short.

title: Casa Smith 2015 Cinghiale Wahluke Slope & Rosebud Vineyards Sangiovese (Wahluke Slope)
description: This wine's macerated cranberry, raspberry jam and dried orange peel aromas are bright. Its raspberry and cranberry flavors are sweet and focused, delivering a lot of appeal, though seeming a bit ripe.

title: Castell d'Encus 2014 Quest Red (Costers del Segre)
description: Hailing from high in the Pyrenees, this wine dances to the beat of its own drummer. Floral red-fruit aromas suggest hot stones and wild brush, accompanying leather and tomato scents on this blend of Bordeaux grapes. A tight, tannic palate is home to herbal plum and tea flavors. The wine is earthy tasting but a bit muddled on the finish.

title: Famille Valéry 2015 Domaine des Deux Ruisseaux Merlot (Pays d'Oc)
description: A touch of green pepper dances on the nose of this otherwise bold, darkly fruited wine. Notes of coffee and brownie lend richness to the palate, fleshing out the crushed-velvet texture and black plum and currant flavors. A final hit of tobacco spice graces the finish.

title: Blanco Nieva 2016 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Punchy citrus and tropical fruit aromas punctuate a stony, varietally correct nose. This Verdejo is slightly plump in feel, with penetrating acidity. Salty, briny apple and nectarine flavors finish clean and minerally.

title: Bouza de Carril 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Briny aromas of cactus and lightly pickled cucumber are more neutral than loud. This is lively on the palate, with citrusy flavors that include a note of orange peel. Mild green-herb flavors and a touch of bitterness on the finish are not uncommon for Albariño.

title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Finger Lakes)
description: Zesty and fresh, this bristling Grüner Veltliner offers pristine tangerine, lime and melon flavors. While delicate in concentration, vibrant acidity and crisp lime pith notes reverberate on the finish. Drink now through 2019.

title: Dubost 2015 Reconciliation Red (Paso Robles)
description: Tart elderberry, purple flowers, anise, bay leaf and other chaparral aromas show on the nose of this blend of 20% Carmenère, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Cabernet Franc, 20% Merlot, 10% Malbec and 10% Petit Verdot. Forest-driven flavors power the palate, where firm but forgiving tannins present black cherry and dark chocolate shavings.

title: Domaine Jessiaume 2015 Les Ecussaux Premier Cru  (Auxey-Duresses)
description: The wine is structured and with bold red fruits. It also has a firm texture, layers of tannins and a solid texture. Acidity shines through at the end. These elements promise a serious wine that will age well. Drink from 2021.

title: Montes 2015 Alpha Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)
description: Aromas of white peach and apple come with mild oak notes. This feels melony and full, with its body weight dictated by tropical fruits. Briny, salty tropical fruit and corn flavors finish with a lasting note of oak.

title: Kestrel 2013 Falcon Series Estate Syrah (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine's aromas are bright and fruit forward, with generous black pepper, raspberry, fresh flower, smoked meat and barrel spice notes. The full-bodied palate delivers cranberry flavors that are appealing but more ponderous than the aromas might suggest.

title: JM Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine's aromas are fruit forward, suggesting cantaloupe, melon and pear. The palate is spicy and broad, bringing a lot of appeal.

title: Parducci 2014 Small Lot Merlot (Mendocino County)
description: Lots of fruit flavor and light spicy touches make this medium-bodied, dry and moderately tannic wine very attractive. Black cherry meets clove and cinnamon, while ample acidity joins with a touch of tannin for a well-balanced texture.

title: Pascal Rollet 2015 Les Grands Climats  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: This wine has an attractive crisp edge refreshes and balances the ripe fruit and the generous texture. Toast flavors from the wood aging underline the richness. Drink now.

title: Nada Giuseppe 2014 Casot  (Barbaresco)
description: This wine's balsamic notes of camphor, oak, toast and crushed mint emerge in the glass while the linear palate offers licorice, sour cherry, cranberry, thyme and tobacco flavors. Close-grained, somewhat astringent tannins lend grip to the finish.

title: Navarro 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This fresh, lively and assertive wine comes off as a touch sweet but it has such tangy acidity that it stays well balanced. Bright cherry and raspberry flavors have a big impact on the palate and will help it pair nicely with strong foods.

title: Everhart Cellars 2014 Estate Grown Happy Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: This drinks like a Port, with extremely ripe and definitely sweet flavors of raisins, dried plums and blackberry jam. It's not so much a dinner wine as something to sip around the campfire or with a dark chocolate dessert.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2016 Federico Paternina Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Tropical-fruit aromas are slightly oily but on target for Verdejo. This wine displays a full, round palate held together by acidity and white-fruit tannins. Lightly salty grapefruit flavors finish moderately long, with citrus overtones. Drink as soon as possible.

title: MCV 2016 Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Yellow peach, lemon, Asian pear and citrus peels show on the nose of this bottling by Matt Villard. It's very light and reserved on the palate, which is what makes it refreshing, with flavors of ripe nectarine, pan-seared apple and cider. A sizzle of acidity runs through it.

title: Vinchio-Vaglio Serra 2011 Vecchie Vigne 50  (Barbera d'Asti)
description: Black-skinned berry, tilled soil and baking spice aromas lead the way in this wine. Made from very old vines, it delivers blackberry, star anise and clove flavors alongside round tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy through 2021.

title: Pellegrini Vineyards 2015 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Pellegrini's standard-label Chardonnay offers a brightness and vibe that stands out against the winery's oakier Vintner's Blend. There's ample toast and spice here, but it's deftly applied, highlighting the wine's rich, slightly leesy texture. Fresh acidity lends balance and grace. Drink now through 2020.

title: Union Beaujolaise 2015 Domaine des Trois Tilleuls  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: The wine has delicious acidity as well as lively fruitiness. An attractive mineral texture offers a tangy view of a ripe vintage. Drink this crisp wine now.

title: Seguin-Manuel 2015  Viré-Clessé
description: Rich tropical fruits are balanced by attractive acidity in this full, mineral-textured wine that's ripe and crisp at the same time. Drink this attractive, balanced wine now.

title: Siegel 2014 Single Vineyard Los Lingues Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: Cool, herbal berry aromas are a touch green, typical of Los Lingues. This Cabernet features choppy tannins and a rough mouthfeel. Dry, oaky plum and berry flavors finish with hard spice and tomato-sauce notes. Drink through 2023.

title: Sobon Estate 2015 Cougar Hill Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: A distinctive cedar and smoke character makes this medium-bodied wine interesting to taste, and the herb and ripe black-cherry flavors underneath give it a substantial fruit component. It's light on tannins but big on flavor.

title: Sottimano 2014 Fausoni  (Barbaresco)
description: Balsamic aromas of menthol, eucalyptus and new leather lead the nose of this wine, along with a whiff of oak-driven spice. On the firm, linear palate, espresso and mocha notes accent raw red berry fruit while assertive, close-grained tannins grip the finish.

title: Stasis 2014 Murmur Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Cola, root beer and Red Hots candy play against strawberry, pomegranate and damson on the nose of this playful Pinot Noir. Rusty cranberry, tart red plums and a bit of garrigue spice play on the palate.

title: Rioja Vega 2016 Edición Limitada Rosado (Rioja)
description: Raspberry and plum aromas are fresh and inviting. A full, fresh, popping palate is lively, while a cross of cherry, raspberry and citrus flavors is whetting and tasty. A zesty, steady finish confirms the fairly high quality.
